Carry out is terrible, literally had to wait 30 minutes over the time I was given for pick up. Despite checking with them multiple times, the carry out structure is a mess and because of that I am giving this place 1 star.
Food is bad for the price, service horrible. I felt very uncomfortable eating there.

We were seated at 6:45 and my meal hadn’t arrived when we left at 8:20. My sisters and I had a 6:45 reservation and were seated quickly. It was ten or fifteen minutes until the waitress stopped by our table, so we ordered drinks and our meals at the same time to keep things moving. The next time  our waitress stops by - half an hour later - she is surprised to see that two of us don’t have our food. At 7:55, my sister’s meal finally arrives, and I’m reassured mine is coming soon. At 8:10, the waitress lets me know that it will be a while longer, and we tell her we’ll just be leaving. She leaves to get the check for the drinks and my sisters’ meals. At 8:20, without ever having received my meal or even the check for our drinks and my sisters’ meals, we leave cash on the table and leave. There are endless great restaurant options on Southwest Boulevard and nearby Crossroads. Pick literally anywhere else.

I'm so sad. My boyfriend and I took my son out- just home from college- for what we thought would be an amazing dinner- based on our past experiences. Honestly, truly, my very expensive drink tasted like water with lime juice. Same with my boyfriend's drink. Not a good sign when every dish needs table salt added. Would have ordered more food, including dessert- maybe gambled on another drink. Instead we were given the check in passing and our credit card and receipt were returned in the same manner. This was our "really special-save up money- twice a year kinda $$$ that we really don't have" evening. I am so disappointed
weird taste, crowded seating, awkward parking, trip when leaving, overall a disappointment

The food : not bad, the staff !! I didn’t feel welcome at all. The girl who received us on the front door “ I think she want to kick us out” looking at us by disguising look! Putting my plates so far from me! I didn’t enjoy my food because of this!!
I don't remember me servers name, however will NOT be coming back. Felt as if it was an awkward atmosphere. DID NOT feel comfortable and didn't look very clean back in the kitchen area.
Server was ridiculously untrained.  Will be a while before I return.  Too many other wonderful restaurants on the Boulevard to enjoy.

Disrespectful staff, waiter/waitress no where to be found. My wife and I were seated with our sleeping 7 month old next to the loudest table in the place and was asked to place him on the ground under our table. After waiting 20 min and getting no table service we had no choice but to leave. Do your self a favor and find a better establishment to spend your money.

It is my worst experience for my guests and I here in Kansas City Restaurant called "La Bodega". First, I order a Grilled chicken/ Pollo a la Parrilla with Cheese and Pincho de Pollo y Chorizo, waiting for 10 min, and they told that they have 1 Grilled Chicken only around 2:30pm, well I ordered a different dish for my friend, 5 min later they told us they don't have the other dish that we ordered. Finally, Everyone ordered different dishes, and those were raw. Very disappointed. The manager told us, sorry it happens! I never make bad comments because I understand that businesses have good and bad things, but the truth is that this was my worst experience. I felt worse for inviting my friends to a place like this!!!
We had a nice sized bill with the worst service ever!  I will not be going back here anytime soon.  We waited an hour for 4 meatballs and some toast with goat cheese on it.  Ridiculous.

The pitcher of sangria had no fruit, and filled with ice. Just a few slices of Apple in a wine glass.  Way over priced for the service.  The outdoor seating is very noisy, it sits under a highway overpass. Not worth the money.
Disrespectful staff, poor service and a lack of urgency. Waited for 45 minutes for a sandwich that takes 5 minutes to make. Don't waste your time.
The food was awful.
Don't  like it, to much fat!
Music is terrible no alternate options in menu seats out side are terrible feels like I'm going to get a bloat just sitting also bees and flies every where.

Such a charming, quirky little spit to grab some breakfast and coffee! The staff even drew little cartoons on our coffee cups! I had the Sink (?) which was a box full of potatoes, eggs, chorizo, pico, cheese, and salsa verde. It was huge and really tasty! My wife got the Pigs in a blanket. Basically crepes around sausages with eggs on the side. If we are ever back in KC, we’ll be back!
Outstanding place for quality Brunch. I love this place, great food & service. Service treated us so kindly. The bill was fair I would say. I see why this place has so many great reviews.

Didn't eat here. Tried to go for breakfast but no one seemed to know what was going on. No hostess, a bunch of people standing around. Couldn't tell if you ordered and then sat down or if that line was just for take out...
Overpriced, tasteless, rude staff. Won't return.
Not impressed. Overpriced, food sub par quality, employees cluelessly running around with no idea what’s going on.
Don’t waste your money here. Rude employees.

The place is hip and cool but food is like at a cheap diner. I’ve never had a flatter omelet and portabella mushrooms inside were still cold. My latte came with food in about 30 min (!) and was not good....potatoes were cold. The service wasn’t the best either. Street parking was easy.

Don't use them for catering!! Services promised were not rendered. Ran out of drinks for kids and adults at our wedding reception after 30 minutes. We had to find our own bartender the DAY before our wedding because, all of a sudden they didn't have the staff to accommodate this (even though we were told they would). Owner is very rude and difficult to work with. Best to just use someone else.

Ordered takeout and was quoted 15 minutes showed up and waiting via instructions was told food would be ready in a minute. Asked a server after 20 minutes of waiting if our food was ready and turns out it was and had been just sitting their getting cold. Was then told by the server we were rude for getting her attention to ask for our food.

Rude staff. Were there two hours and never got any food. After 30 minutes after we ordered we were told it take an hour to get our food. So we just left. People that came in after us we're getting their food. If you're looking for bad service  and a unclean place to eat. This would be the perfect restaurant for you.
Absolutely horrible. We had bugs in our food!!! And the employees were rude!

Told 20 minute wait and to wait outside in the cold or back by the kitchen. Then the staff kept telling us to get away from the kitchen but there was no place to go. After waiting 45+ minutes for a table we ordered... And waited over an hour for our food... We finally left when we were told-- "didn't they tell you it would be an hour before you get your food even after you get your table?" No. They didn't. We left with out food.
Unapologetically closed early.
Too weird of an atmosphere for me. :/ Didn't feel comfortable here. I ended up not eating because my friend and I felt so uncomfortable. Just honestly too weird.

This business supports Planned Parenthood! Looking forward to a wonderful brunch and walked out due to their signs everywhere for their plannted parenthood fundraiser. Stick to your good food and stay out of politics.

First time here. Can’t be seated until your whole party is in. Can’t order a drink at the bar while you wait. I will likely never come back due to the poor service which stinks because I love juice and the menu looks good. Terrible customer service

Waited an hour only to be told that their system wasn’t working and they and texted us... yet we received no text. Service was average and the atmosphere was very unwelcoming. The food was the most disappointing. Nothing special about this place at all.

Came here for breakfast while we were in KC and it was terrible. In fact, we ended up leaving without eating at the restaurant after sending back our pancakes twice because they weren’t at all cooked. But don’t worry, after all that they still charged us for our juices. Really terrible experience.
Great food! Service was excellent. Clean space, fresh product. Food arrived warm and exactly as described in the menu. Definitely going back!
Great food, excellent service. The Cafe is adorable. Love the menu.
Amazing food and great service! I recommend their fresh juice! I plan on going back next week.

I’ve lived as far as the west coast and have never experienced brunch quite like Succotash. The service is always amazing with unique personalities I adore. Not only is the food and service on parr, but the progressive values are a huge perk creating a really accepting atmosphere. There’s a reason you wait an hour to be seated and it’s because it’s worth the wait.
Wonderful food as always. Fastest I have ever gotten my food. Due to covid there is no seating inside but you can walk up, order food, and sit out side.
An amazing spot to eat. I got the build your $10 scrambler woth Marble Rye bread. It was amazing. I recommend this place highly.

Stopped in for breakfast on the morning of the SuperBowl largely due to good reviews on here. So glad we did! It's a blend of old-fashioned and modern at the same tie. I ordered the special red velvet pancakes that they had in honor of the Chiefs making it to the SuperBowl and they were outstanding. They literally outdid themselves by making a Chiefs arrowhead with yellow frosting on my cakes (see pic)

We had and unexpected hospital stay for our newborn back in January. Succotash was a welcome ray of sunshine in our stay. Great service, amazing food, and decor that tells you that you have come the right place.

Two words: Pork Hash. Wow, was it delicious! It's pricy at $13, but it's worth it at least once. We had excellent service. The place was jam packed with people waiting outside, but they still got us in sooner than they said they would. We were in a hurry to see a show at Crown Center, and our waitress accommodated us very well. We want to come back soon to try more menu items!
Nice site for quality brunch. Don't fret if it's busy, it is worth the wait. I've had nothing but great experiences here and will keep coming back.
Brunch, so great. This location is absolutely outstanding. Definitely worth a return trip. Prices were reasonable.
The squash omelet was to die for! Very friendly service and very good with keeping up to date and on top of the covid regulations. Way to push through the struggle!
From the Rosemary caramel latte to the pancake burrito everything was outstanding! The fun eclectic decor just adds to the charm! If you're in the Kansas City area you must check this place out!!!
The food was delicious, biscuits and gravy with French toast!

Oh my goodness, this place is amazing! I don't know how I've never been here before. Our waitress was fantastic and recommended several things. We settled on splitting the smoked salmon salad (freaking amazing ❤) and the gluten-free Maggie Cristo. I also the rosemary caramel latte, which was just as good as the food. There were so many ways to customize what you wanted, and I'm so excited to go back and try more amazing food.
Got the Bodybuilder and loved it. The Cubano juice is a little too cucumber-heavy, but everything  was great overall.

SO GOOD!!!! Staff is EXCELLENT and the food is incomparable! You have to try Succotash! While my pictures are not the best as we got take out, I’ve never had a better grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup. Highly recommend!!
One of my favorite breakfast spots :)
Great food, quick service, generous portions. Take out only right now due to COVID, but their patio was perfect to sit in with my food!

My absolute FAVORITE breakfast/brunch joint! My boyfriend and I try to go every Sunday and have never been disappointed! The service is consistently satisfying, the atmosphere is cozy and hip the decor is funky and fun, and the food... ohman... it’s mouth watering to think about and even better to eat! The Rosemary Caramel Latte is probably one of the best lattes I’ve ever had! I get it every time I go and my boyfriend always gets the Cubano juicer. Their Benedicts are fabulous and the Specials are always very unique and popping with flavor. It’s off the beaten path being located in a neighborhood but something you don’t want to miss! There’s almost always a wait or line when we go (between 10:30am-1pm) so be prepared to possibly wait, but it’s worth it!
I love this neighborhood treasure! Great food and atmosphere! The coffee is from "Oddly Correct". Strong and tasty! Excellent and friendly staff and service! Very worth the wait!
Relaxed atmosphere, fresh ingredients, and a litany of delicious juices and coffees. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a unique mainstay to the KC area
Vegan pancakes!!! And the coffee was just what I needed. Strong but not bitter! It’s a honey of a spot. So glad this Minneapolis gal found it!

Eclectic. Funky. Hip. Cozy. Fun. Satisfying. The different hashes & breakfasts are phenomenal! Nice mix of breakfasts & lunch dishes made with a special culinary flair. They've got traditional  comfort style food (think eggs, beef, salads, pork, bacon, burgers) but also vegan, gluton free, and hallal.  We had The Modern Elvis - a vegan take on french toast with peanut butter, bananas, & caramel that tastes awesome (warning! also heavy & rich), vegan pancakes with fruit bowl, & a traditional short stack. Everything was fabulous (& we aren't even vegan). If you haven't eaten here yet, you are missing great food and a unique experience. Come once, you'll come back.
Service was amazing, food was great. I wish there was a little more space for waiting. The Southwest kitchen sink was delicious
brunch and the scene here is very good. Quick, helpful, and friendly service. Prices that won't break you.
Great service and even better food. Nice little place to go for a great breakfast with family or friends. I got Swedish pancakes, which came with a side of eggs and bacon!

Super cute, quaint, eclectic little breakfast hideaway. Great service. Lots of vegetarian options, but lots for the meat lovers also. I cannot pass up vegetarian biscuits and gravy - oh, so good it was! Friend had the french toast and bacon; my mom ate her leftovers and said fantastic especially the bacon. Fresh squeezed OJ was outstanding. I would go back again in a heartbeat.
Huge portions! Delicious quality food and drinks (coffee, latte, fresh pressed juice). Cute hipster goth like decor and staff.

Vegan brought me here. Absolutely loved the menu. Ordered the smoked salmon club without bacon & a side of home fries. Was incredibly delicious. The "best lemonade" very refreshing. Atmosphere was unique & fun. Staff was knowledgeable & helpful.
Really good variety of food that all tastes delicious.

Whew. The food is SO good here! Love the art and atmosphere. I went on a Friday morning and the place already had a wait list. Very impressive! I ordered the Kitchen Sink and it did not disappoint. I also got a juice, the Cubano, and it was refreshing and flavorful. I look forward to visiting again soon.

This cute spot is perfect for breakfast/brunch. The portion sizes are big and so were the smiles! Service was friendly and the flavor was great! Stop in for the french toast and seasonal snickerdoodle latte!

We LOVED Succotash. Our only mistake was both getting the spicy BLT on special because it was too tempting and not trying another dish. My husband, a BLT connoisseur (as one when is when they think eggs are “icky”), cites this as his favorite to date. We also loved the fresh squeezed juices. Can’t wait to go back!
This place had some of the best vegan bfast I've had!
Busy place when they open so you know it's good! Special was a morel mushroom omelette. Il this place is worth the wait!

Wow! What can I say other than AMAZING! I had the Burrito of Love and it blew my world. We sat at the bar and loved how friendly the staff was, the great food, the fun music, and great eclectic atmosphere.

Even though the restaurant was very busy (we visited on a Saturday morning), we were seated immediately. We ordered our coffees (rosemary caramel lattes and an Americano) and those took a while to come out, but they were delicious. The food came out shortly after and it was fantastic. Their menu is interesting with a lot of unique dishes, including burritos with pancakes instead of tortillas and a goat cheese/lingonberry/ham sandwich on sourdough French toast. The only thing that could have used improvement was the home fries, which were basically just pan fried potatoes that weren't crispy or seasoned. Overall though, this place was superb and we will definitely be back!

Delicious! A surprise delivery of many ready made sandwiches and salad brought to the hospital. This restaurant made fresh food for very appreciative staff workers! It was delicious and I cannot wait until I can have more! Thank you!
Solid spot for breakfast and great coffee.

I went to Succotash for breakfast with some friends recently for the first time since I was in college over 10 years ago.  I honestly had forgotten about it because I live on the Kansas side.  It was fabulous.
Great food. Great staff. Socially responsible patio dining.

Very unique restaurant with the decor. I was a lil iffy about dining here, my son picked out the place. I was pleasantly surprised by the service and the food was GREAT! I ordered the candied bacon shortstack with maple butter. I didn't realize the bacon would be in the pancakes, OMG but they were so delicious. Orange juice was fresh squeezed. I was totally stuffed, everything was perfect! I would definitely consider visiting again.

The food and service was exceptional. I had a cup of tomato bisque to start with, which is one of the better ones I've had. Nothing amazing, but solid flavors. I had the Maggie Cristo for the entree. The blend of goat cheese, lingonberry sauce, and ham all balanced each other very well. The mixture of salty, earthy, sweet, and bitter flavors went together very nicely, but the potatoes could use a little more seasoning. I had the Cup of Sunshine to drink which was superb as well. I don't normally like celery, but it paired well with all the fruit juices.

We’re picky when it comes to food and we found this diamond in the rough on our road trip, and we’re thoroughly surprised. The gluten free pancakes were especially amazing, but the service was exceptional. Clifford made us feel at home, even on the road! Going to make this a regular stop on our cross country travels home!

The staff is friendly and so accommodating. Succotash also makes it a point to support their employees with fair wages and also feed the homeless. The restaurant decor is art deco and all around fun and conversation pieces. Their food is top notch, affordable and they have gluten free options.
Great place, oozing with character, great food and friendly service. Eclectic and good energy. Would definitely come back next time in KC.
Pancakes as big as your plate and pressed juice to die from. Staff was so attentive and charming.

We try to stop here every time we go to KCMO. Fantastic locally sourced food. Always delicious! Something is available for omnivores, vegetarians & vegans alike. Staff are super friendly. Closes in the afternoon, so no dinner here. Great breakfasts!

Succotash is a Kansas City Staple. Paris has the Eiffel Tower, Springfield has crystal meth, we've got Succotash. Somehow, it's so hipster that it feels anti-hipster (which, let's face it, is super hipster.) I've never had a bad experience here. The serving style is super laissez-fair, and I don't mean that in a bad way. No one takes themselves that seriously and, in return, you just don't set your bar too high. Once the food comes out and hits your taste buds, it's an overwhelming experience like no other. I could rave about the French toast for days 🤤 and their fresh-squeezed, housemate juices are so gorgeous & delicious. It's like, "Woah! Wasn't expecting that!"
Love the atmosphere!  Such a down to earth cool vibe.  Best Cuban sandwich I've ever had! Service is always friendly, feels like home

Stopped in for breakfast on the morning of the SuperBowl largely due to good reviews on here. So glad we did! It's a blend of old-fashioned and modern at the same tie. I ordered the special red velvet pancakes that they had in honor of the Chiefs making it to the SuperBowl and they were outstanding. They literally outdid themselves by making a Chiefs arrowhead with yellow frosting on my cakes (see pic). My friend had the pork hash and it looked amazing. The bacon and eggs I had with my pancakes were outstanding and the price was more than reasonable. They even gave us a military discount. They don't have a dedicated parking lot, but don't let that stop you from going in to this place and getting a great breakfast!

This might be the best breakfast I've had and it was definitely the best coffee. True coffee artisans! Worth the wait in line but the waiting list through your phone is super cool. The peachy swedes are an incredibly original dish =amazing! Chorizo Southwest hash was really good. It had a lot of extra ingredients like Pico and verde salsa. So good. The blueberry pancakes are incredible! We had a great time, fun atmosphere, great service even though this place was packed and amazing food.
Had a party of 18, food and service was great,

You know you're in love with a joint when you discover it one day and come back the next with someone else so you can share the experience. The menu is eclectic with flavor combos you wouldn't necessarily think...HUGE, delicious flavors. There's truly something for everyone. And to boot, the staff is incredible. I'll definitely be making another visit...soon!
Excellent food and juices. Plenty of vegan and non-vegan options. There is a long wait, but worth the wait. I highly recommend their "vegan kitchen sink" and veggie sausage.
Delicious food for normal diets, gluten free, and vegans!! Got seated right away even on a Saturday morning and service was good. Great coffee options!
Amazing food. Urban hipster vibe. Great organized menu with many diverse offerings. Portion sizes are very good and justify the cost well. Great option for a brunch.
Amazing food with awesome vegetarian and vegan options. So good you may not wanna tell your grandma about it!
The food was really good and you got a lot of it . I cant wait to go back and eat there again
Trendy brunch eatery. Food was delicious! Try the eggs benedict - you can't go wrong!

Beth, the place is phenomenal and so is the food!!  The pork hash tasted great and the portion was generous.  I kept getting distracted by the amazing dishes that were being served around me.  Thank you so much for inviting me down and I look forward to eating there again and again.
Wow! The gobbler is the best sandwich I have ever had. More flavor than a burger. House salad was killer too!

I didn't know this place was even here or so close to us. It's a pooping little joint. I love that it caters to vegan and vegetarians. You can also substitute the bacon for turkey for chicken if your a meat eater. It's a little in the pricey side but still worth another visit. The water was very helpful also.
We were seated right away which was awesome, because it soon got very busy with a line out the door. The food was delicious, options for gluten free and vegans. Atmosphere was fun and eccentric.
One of the top places to go to in Kansas. Love the Salmon Eggs Benedict. Ask for an egg over easy as they don't poach eggs there. You won't regret it!
LOVE this place! Best brunch in the city, hands down. Delicious affordable food, hip but welcoming staff, creative cool atmosphere! The wait can be long on the weekends but it's definitely worth it!
Fun atmosphere, wonderful food, and great service! It was very busy when there, but still received very attentive service. Highly recommend.

My favorite place to take out of town guests.  I love succotash and always recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to eat.  The atmosphere is wonderful.  It's a bit noisy with all the people sometimes so if you don't like noisy places, avoid it.  Otherwise, I think you'll love it!

My son and I went here while visiting from Omaha for our Father's day trip, and will return the first chance we get! I had the Vegan Sink and it was one of the best vegan dishes I've ever had! My son got the Nutella S'mores French Toast. The food was amazing and the service was exceptional!
We came for the Passport program and also got the meatballs. The Egg Nog drink was good and the meatballs were very good. Service and ambience were good as well!

Awesome experience.  Ambience is upscale, but the environment warm and welcoming. Menu is diverse and the chef made an accommodation that was outstanding!  Madeleine took incredible care of us and added so much to the dinner experience.  Highly recommend!

It was just not good. It had a lot of hype from the hotel front desk staff. Rather than going out to a nicer restaurant we stayed at the hotel and ate there. It is more of a lounge than restaurant, their drink selection was very minimal, my medium rare steak was well done. It was loud having a jazz band there. The service was not great. The drunk man yelling at the tv was icing on the cake. Will not be back and do not recommend.

As always, the service was impeccable. Mary took great care of us throughout our drinks, dinner, and dessert.  The Beef Bourginion was delicious as was the (seasonal) Egg Nog,. Cinnamon instead of nutmeg added a neat twist to the drink.
The hotel was absolutely amazing.  But the restaurant was absolutely horrible.  I mean who serves a steak with no sides. Will never eat there again.

This is my favorite restaurant when I'm staying downtown in Kansas City.  I invariably order the salmon and a couple of glasses of the house red wine.  I can't vouch for anything else, but I could eat that same meal every day.  It's that good.
Service average food pretty good very nice atmosphere
